text:
Google buys Fitbit for $ 19 billion
Google has agreed with Fitbit, known for activity meters and smart watches, to buy the company. The price tag is just over NOK 19 billion.
01 Nov 2019, 14:41 by NTB-AP-TT



üì∑ BRENDAN MCDERMID / X90143 Gallery



Fitbit, which is known among other things for smart watches and activity meters, is acquired by Google. üì∑ Photo: AP / NTB scanpix Gallery


"We have built a trusting brand that supports over 28 million active users around the world," said Fitbit's co-founder and CEO James Park in a joint statement in which the two US companies announce the purchase agreement on Friday.
With the acquisition, Internet giant Google is entering a new segment for portable technology.
Fitbit's share price has risen 40 percent since it became known that Google had bid for the company.
